4427895/4355590/4447854.text:
CuresBurnsA good cure for burns is to place them to the fire and the heat of the fire will kill the pain.Another good cure for burns is to rub soap and bread soda on immediatly after been burned.The above information was given to me by : James Mc Donnel.



Corns.A good cure for corns is to rub unsalted hog-lard of them. The above information was given to me by Michael Murphy.

4493789/4420593/4536971.title: A Story of Gambling
4493789/4420593/4536971.text:
(continued from previous page)
He turned to get across the river at another place. As he turned the girl way standing in his way. When he turned to cross the bridge again she was again in his way. He put out his hand to push her away. As he did so her face changed and all he saw was the ace of Spades. Just then she disappeared. That man never played cards again.



This is a cure used by the people of Morille long ago for corns. If anyone had corns on his feet, he would get a piece of white bread and steep it in vinegar for some time. He then put the mixture on top of the corn and put a bandage over it. After some time the corn went away.
(continues on next page)

Laundry blue possess the same properties.Alice Staunton, Redmount



CornsSteep ivy leaves in vinegar until they become quite soft, then apply to corn.  Secure on toe with a tiny bandage.  Leave on for a few days - night and day.  The corn can generally be removed in about three days.Olive Reynolds, Feamore.



SwellingsGoose grease is a very good cure for swellings.This grease is rubbed into the affected parts and generally cures.Plenty of old Irish people preserve this grease and depend more upon it than on a doctor. Mary KennyRedmount

4649689/4647447/4650915.title: A Cure for a Pain in the Ear
4649689/4647447/4650915.text:
An old man named Johnney Bohan Scardawn, told me that the pain in the ear could be cured by roasting an onion in the fire, and putting the heart of it into the ear, while it is warm. Then leaving it in it, for ten minutes, and then the pain will go away.



Corns can be cured in the following way. First get houseleek. Pull it and pound it with a stick. Then rub a piece of butter or lard to it. Put the houseleek on the corn then, by putting a piece of cloth round it. Tie it tightly so that it would not
(continues on next page)

4658445/4656293/4661116.title: A Cure for Wildfire
4658445/4656293/4661116.text:
First you get a red coal out of the fire. You bless yourself in the name of the Father, Son and Holy Ghost. Then you point the red-coal to where the wildfire is three times, saying In the name of the Father, Son and Holy Ghost each time while pointing.



1 Bathe the corns with paraffin oil for three nights. 2 Rub them with castor oil nightly.

4658454/4657267/4662280.title: Local Cures - Mumps
4658454/4657267/4662280.text:
Mumps. Meet a man riding a white horse accidentally. Ask him for a cure and do whatever he tells you.James O'Rourke(86)



Put an asses' head stall on the person afflicted. Lead him around the pig sty three times saying " Pig O the mumps" while doing it J. O'Rourke(86)



To take out thorn- Chew leaf put it on a piece of cloth lie arounf thorn.John Maxwell, Carrickmakeegan.



Corn: Melt pieces of candle, melt it and pour parafin over it and put it on the corn. J. Maxwell



Get a leaf of slánlus and boil it in a cup of water mix with butter and place it on cut.



To Draw Boils: Roast Slánlus leaf and apply- one side (the smooth) draws, the other side heals.

(a) Soap and sugar poultice(b) A thin slice of potato.(c) Get a dog to lick it. For a sore finger, hold it in boiling water in which potatoes were boiled.(d) A grated potato poultice



(a) Three hairs taken from the dog which bit and and rubbed on the wound.(c) There is a cure in the hair of the dog which bit.



Hold the ear over a basin of hot water.



The cure for foul-mouth is that anyone who has never seen his father should blow his breath on the person afflicted and he will be cured.

3. Wash your feet in Washingsoda



4. Get a piece of lean beef steep in vinegar put a little bit on corn each day it will come out without cutting

4742154/4740650/4782659.text: A cure for corns is to walk bare-footed in the dewy grass early in the morning.

4769972/4763382/4785054.text:
if two people bearing the same name were married - they could cure thrush by breathing into the childs face.



a child who is born after her fathers death can cure thrush.



hold the baby who has thrush over pigs in a pig sty and say nuckna, huckna skin of the levine, leicne leicne leicne, skin of the huckna and the baby will be cured.



boil chicken weed and bathe your feet in the water before going to bed- don't put your feet on the ground.



a cure for corns is boiled ivy leaves

Carry a small new potato around with you in your pocket. Wear red flannel next your skin.Eat plenty of new celery.Sting yourself with nettles.



CornsSoak the feet in washing soda for ten minutes rub on a little olive oil, then you easily pick them out.

4769976/4763658/4929030.title: Ailments and Cures - To Draw and Heal a Wound
4769976/4763658/4929030.text:
Get a cabbage leaf. Place it on the wound with the rough side of back of back the leaf against the wound bandage it on and leave it there till the wound gets clean and clear. That will draw the wound.Get a fresh leaf then put the smooth side or front of the leaf to the sore. This will heal the wound.joseph Mahonballinalarna Athy                        Cornsget a turnip and cut a slice off it. cut a hole in the flat cut face of the turnip. fill it with salt. leave it until the salt is wet. then put your toe into it. do this about three times and the corn will come out.



Get a turnip and cut a slice off it. Cut a hole in the flat cut face of the turnip. Fill it with salt. Leave it until the salt is wet. Then put your toe into it. Do this about three times and the corn will come out

4769976/4763664/4929045.title: Ailments and Cures - Corns
4769976/4763664/4929045.text: The cure for corns is to get a thin piece of fat bacon and put it to the corn for a day and do this for a few days until the corn goes away. This is a good cure because I seen my father doing it.

4922101/4852372/4948239.title: Local Cures - Jaundice
4922101/4852372/4948239.text:
Jaundice1. It was cured by boiling a certain weed out of a graveyard in water. Then give the liquid to the person with the disease.2. It was also cured by mixing goose droppings and stout together and drinking the mixturePeggy Halpin 16.11.1937



Corns These were cured by steeping an ivy leaf in vinegar and applying it to the corn.Peggy Halpin 11.11.1937



Sore EyesThere were cured by getting a plant called robin-run-the-hedge. This was boiled in water and the person washed their eyes in the liquid. This is how sore eyes were cured. Bridget O'Connell22.11.1937

4922210/4860888/5016005.title: Local Cures - Chilblains
4922210/4860888/5016005.text:
Chilblains1. Well boil crabs in water, strain and bathe the affected parts in the liquid2. Rub goose grease to the chilblains, and allow it to soak in before the fire3. Bathe the affected parts in parafin oil



Corns1. Steep an ivy leaf in vinegar and place on the corn2. Bathe the corn in alum water3. Apply ivy leaf steeped in paraffin oil4. Apply the skin of a boiled potato



Ringworm1. Sulphur and fresh lard2. Write your name in ink round the ringworm taking care that you leave no break in the ring

4922271/4866158/5072127.title: Cures - Corns
4922271/4866158/5072127.text:
I heard this cure for corns at home.  The cure is - when you get up in the morning put on your shoes and walk to a bog.  Then take off your shoes and walk through the bog this is to be done while the dew is on the grass.  It is said that this will cure the corns.



I got a cure at home for pains.  The cure is to make dandeline wine and to put in in a bottle for six weeks.  When the six weeks are up the person who suffers should drink twice a day and it is said that it would cure the pains.



I heard this story at home.  When Willie Brennan was on the highway around Araglen he hid the gold there.  This man used to rob the rich people and give the money to the poor.  Before he was hanged he hid the gold at the three Doon.  there are three little hills where the money is hidden.  A certain family went looking for it but could not find it.  The day he was hanged he told where the gold was hidden.

5070833/5068718/5099597.title: A Corn
5070833/5068718/5099597.text: A corn was a vessel similar to a frying pan only that it was oval in shape. The lead was melted in it + then poured into a small mould to make the bullet.

5008962/4971268/5110982.text:

Make a poultice of boiled Marsh Mallows. Apply round ankle or wrist.



If a person had an earache extract the juice from an ash stick by putting it over the fire. Let this juice cool and drop it into the ear.To roll an onion in several layers of wet brown paper and roast in open fire and when soft squeeze out of the onion and let the juice cool and drop into ear for earache.



Roast a black snail in wet brown paper and apply to a corn.



Put the raw white of an egg over any cut and it will prevent a scar.

5009089/4985531/5121612.title: Cures - Cure for a Cough
5009089/4985531/5121612.text:
Cure for a cough.  Put salt on garlic and eat it.  Mrs Seery, Grange, Ballinalack, Co. Westmeath.  She is about twenty three years of age.



Cure of a burn.  Rub sweet oil on the burn every morning for three days.  Miss Murtagh, Cullenhue, Ballinalack, Co. Westmeath.  She is about thirty six years of age.



Cure for a bleeding finder.  Get a dandeline leaf and chew it and tie it on the finger.  Miss Gretta Wallace, Ballinalack, Co. Westmeath got this cure from her Aunt.  She is fourteen years of age.



Mr Shannon, Streete, Co. Westmeath says that if you churn butter on a May day and keep a portion of it over unsalted for twelve months it will remove a thorn.



Cure for Corns.  Thomas Smith, Clonave, Coole, Co. Westmeath has the cure for corns.  He puts a plaster on the corn.  This plaster is the shape of a penny, and the corn goes in a few days.  He is seventy three years of age.



Cure for cancer.  John Veldon, Multyfarnham, Co. Westmeath is a seventh son and he has a cure
(continues on next page)

5044646/5028682/5148222.title: Old Cures
5044646/5028682/5148222.text:
Old Cures.This is an exellent cure for piles. Get a weed called Verbine and about half pound of lard. Put both into a small pot and melt them together until they form an oil. Then put the oil into a jam-jar or an old jug and it will thicken and become and ointment. If it is not wanted for immediate used put a cover over the jar or jug.



This old cure was very much used in olden times. It is used for chilblains. it consists of a potatoe or onion choped up and rubbed to the chilblains. Another cure for chilblains is the following:- boils potatoes and strain the water off, mix about three ounces of washing soda with the potatoe water and wash the feet in the water.



A Cure for CornsA good cure which was much used in olden times for corns. It is to make a paste of bread-soda and stick it to a cloth. And put it to the corns. This kills the root of the corn and gives great ease to the sufferer. This cure is very useful to persons who are troubled by corns.
